task.title: Washing Clothes in a Stackable Machine
task.shortdesc: University Housing apartments have an in-unit stackable laundry machine. Stackable machines are free for residents.

p.note: The stackable's bottom machine is the washing machine.

step.cmd: Put dirty clothes in the washing machine drum located at the bottom of the stackable unit.
Separate clothes by color and fabric type to prevent damage or color bleeding.
Add the appropriate amount of detergent to the washing machine.

choices.choice: If using a pod, put it in the washing machine drum before adding clothes.
If using liquid or powdered detergent, put it into the detergent compartment in the pull-out drawer, typically located on the top section of the machine.

step.cmd: Add bleach and/or fabric softener to their respective compartments in the drawer if needed.
Close the washing machine door securely.
Select the appropriate wash settings on the control panel, usually located above the washing machine door.

info.note: The settings will reset to default after each use, so check the panel before each wash cycle.

step.cmd: Press the start button to begin washing.
